titles.title: Prohibiting Taxpayer-Funded Monuments to Members of Congress Act
To prohibit certain real property from being named after a sitting Member of Congress.
Prohibiting Taxpayer-Funded Monuments to Members of Congress Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.

committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure
committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management

bill.summary: Prohibiting Taxpayer-Funded Monuments to Members of Congress Act - Prohibits any real property that is under the jurisdiction of the federal government or constructed using federal funds from being named after, or otherwise officially identified by the name of, any Member of Congress.
